page.title: 16The Leaning Spire.
page.content: { }How many tipplers, emerging from the "Crown" and gazing heavenwards upon the spire, have turned to stagger back for "just one more"? The church tower, whose spire leans seven feet out of vertical, seems to hover in a frozen "fall" across the road. { } No traveller, passing through the village, could overlook the rakish lean of St.Laurence's spire. The visitor is told how, centuries ago, the stones began to lean even as the ancient workers set them up. Undeterred, they carried on and Surfleet has a spire to rival Chesterfield. Indeed, we have a fenland Pisa tower defying gravity centuries before Newton. The capital has Big Ben, Edinburgh the Rock, but our symbol is St.Laurence spire, nonchalent yet strong as time.
